boat.name: Little Windflower

owners.note: The boat had been out of the water at Moody's at Swanick, River Hamble for 20 years whilst her then owner struggled to restore her. John Richardson took her over and completed the work. He sold her to Nick Temple.
owners.text: The boat had been out of the water at Moody's at Swanick, River Hamble for

boat.full_description: When John Richardson found Little Windflower she had been in Moody's yard on the Hamble for many years. He completed her refit and then went long distance cruising in her.He sailed her to the Caribbean and back.
boat.construction_details: Greenheart keel, keelson, garboards & 1st 7 streaks, with afromosia decks.  Iton keel and internal ballast
boat.short_description: Little Windflower was built as a yacht in1890. She was owned by Frank Cowper who wrote Sailing Tours. In 1984 John Richardson saied herr to the West Indies and back in 1984-5
